articles.author: Christoph Kappey
articles.description: In this post, you'll learn how to implement Architecture Decision Records (ADRs) in your organization, based on best practices developed from experience with over 200 ADRs across multiple projects. You'll also discover practical tips for streamlining architectural decision-making, see real-world examples from projects with teams ranging from 10 to over 100 members, and understand the common challenges in architecture decision-making and how ADRs can help address them.
articles.title: Master architecture decision records (ADRs): Best practices for effective decision-making

articles.author: Antoine Boucherie
articles.description: In this post, we explore an intermediate strategy between the pilot light and the warm standby strategies: pilot light with reserved capacity. You can use this strategy to reserve compute capacity in a secondary Region while also limiting cost.
articles.title: Pilot light with reserved capacity: How to optimize DR cost using On-Demand Capacity Reservations

sources.title: The latest from GitHub's engineering team - The GitHub Blog

articles.author: Spotify Engineering
articles.description:
There’s a brand new engineering certification in town: Certified Backstage Associate (CBA). Offered through The Linux Foundation, the certification shows that you have the skills and knowledge to build and manage Backstage — the open framework for internal developer portals (IDPs) that was developed at Spotify and is now used at thousands of companies around the world. If you’re interested in building your engineering career — or just want to know more about what makes Backstage such a popular platform for developer experience — here’s everything I learned from taking the CBA exam.
The post An Insider’s Tips for Taking the Certified Backstage Associate (CBA) Exam appeared first on Spotify Engineering.
articles.title: An Insider’s Tips for Taking the Certified Backstage Associate (CBA) Exam

articles.author: pmm
articles.description: This post was co-authored by Henrique Santana, Container Specialist, AWS and Luis Felipe, Principal Solutions Architect, AWS. Introduction Many organizations have built their infrastructure using Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) and Network Load Balancer (NLB), often with security policies built around the NLB’s static IP addresses. As these organizations adopt containerization and move to […]
articles.title: Effortless application modernization: migrate to Amazon EKS with existing NLB setup

articles.description: The EU plan to borrow €800 Billion for defense was rejected by the Dutch Parliament. articles.description: We are closing the cleartext HTTP ports entirely for Cloudflare API traffic. This prevents the risk of clients unintentionally leaking their secret API keys in cleartext during the initial request.
